speaker: Michie Ang
title: Tangle No More: A open discussion on cord organization
description: This will be a discussion about Cord/Wiring Organization. If you are thinking about organizing your cords or wants to share your own cord setup, come join the discussion. Let's untangle those cords one by one!

speaker: Mary Jeykle Sunas
title: Vision Boarding: Your Dream Workspace
description:
We all have our dream workspace. Having a home workspaces has suddenly become important with most of us are working from home in this time of pandemic.

In this activity we will be have a vision boarding of our dream work from home setup/workspace. Vision boarding is an excellent way to get clear on your goals and be motivated to bring them to reality. 

Before the event, participants need to prepare these supplies:

- A board for your base. Cork, wire, or a magnetic whiteboard would all work.

- Scissors.

- Depending on your base, pushpins, tape or glue, magnets, or clips to secure images.

- Images or objects that resonate with you and your goal that can be placed on your board. Think magazine clippings, photos, quotes, and more. 

- Stickers, markers, or any other extras you want to add, if you so wish.

speaker: Freilla Mae Espinola
title: Game Night: Mobile Legends
description: We will be playing a casual 5v5 game in Mobile legends.

speaker: Ce Manalang
profession: Cartoonist, Comic Strip Artist, Writer and Web Developer
title: Sketchnoting
description: Introduction to visual tech note-taking or how to prepare for your next pictionary night: tech edition

speaker: Kim Morano
title: Automating Life with AppScript
description: Make the most out of the tools we have with a GMail account.

speaker: Karen Matala
title: Honest Guide to Remote Work
description: Karen will share about the guide to remote work that is not trying to sell you anything. She got fortunate enough to remote work amidst the pandemic and she will share her tips and insights gained working remotely.

speaker: Mars Gabutero
title: Hugot Huwebes Online
description: Join us for a casual get-together to talk about different dev-related topics over virtual drinks. This event will follow the lean coffee format, in which participants build an agenda and discuss topics collectively. Bring your best #devhugot lines and meet new friends from the tech community!

speaker: Azel Tan
title: Online Game Night: Among Us
description: March is ending soon and this will be the last Friday of the month. Sit down, chill, and catch up with us or meet new friends while playing Among Us. Please install among us before the event to save time. If you haven't played it yet, don't worry we will guide you. The more the merrier, so come and play with us. :)

speaker: Charo Nuguid
title: The Art of Technical Writing
description: When one talks about technical writing, it often brings up notions of people writing user manuals and documentation. In reality, it goes beyond that and is a required skill whether you're sending an email to your boss or applying for a job. The Art of Technical Writing will give you the 101 on how to do written formal correspondence for almost any situation.
